title: Will there be any items added in or changed for the Mage Update?

replies.body: Yes. Primarily modifications to existing items, we'll likely add a new component or two to help with build paths though.

Can we expect to see a drop in Deathcap's price? A straight offensive item with no utility or durability is never going to be worth 3800 gold. It's got a super clunky build path too because of how absurd the price is, it's more expensive to build a Deathcap from its components than it is to buy a NLR.

I'd generally compare Deatcap to IE as an item. The difference between these two right now is that IE is a bigger boost to your damage for 200 less gold.
Could really use a new AP item that grants armor, similar to how AD gets both MAW and Mercurial.
Zeke's is in a terrible spot right now, and it's super niche for support. You should NEVER buy it mid lane vs an AD.
I mean at that point get something like frozen heart and get an item that gives a lot of ap. instead of getting almost no ap and almost no armor.
But that costs far more than Maw, which gives both AD and MR. How is it fair for AP mid laners to have to get 2 items when AD mid laners only have to get one?
To be fait there is no AD armor item either.

There is a reason for that: they don't want marksmen taking such an item to counter other marksmen or AD assassins, we already see the annoyance of Sterak's Gage or Mercurial Scimitar on marksmen. That's one thing on IBG Ezreal that people overlook, but can be really annoying once you think about it, and contributes to him being a pain in the a**.
Then what about the AP MR items we have? Is that different to AD Armor?

I honestly can't say, what I said is only what I recall coming across as an answer one, I could be wrong. As for mages, Athene's and Zhonya's are sort of defensive AP items available to mages because mages aren't marksmen: their damage is limited to cooldowns and they lack sustained damage, hence why they have no real way of dealing with tanks.

While many mages are vulnerable to assassins if building full glass cannon, they have options like Rod of Ages and Rylai's and/or Liandry's (which give health in addition to AP and other nifty things) on top of Zhonya's and Athene's that give them means of reacting to an assassin, AP or AD. So they don't have a forced intentional weakness to assassins all throughout the game that marksmen are supposed to have.

Can we expect new/reworked items with impactful actives?

Please make an item that has CDR. Hell, make it 10% CDR and low AP/Mana/something so its worth it if you want to max out CDR but not worth it for the other stats.

Mages only ever build Morello/Athene, Lucidicty Boots by sacrificing Sorc Boots' MPen, or the niche Lichbane for CDR, and thats a pathetically low amount of options to get such an essential stat, especially compared to tanks/ADCs. I know mages are "stronger" with CDR than ADCs (you guys have said this before), but the lack of options to get CDR is pathetic for AP champs.

I know mages are "stronger" with CDR than ADCs (you guys have said this before), but the lack of options to get CDR is pathetic for AP champs.

In that case, Riot should re-add those ap items from the Black Market Brawler minigame.  They provide everything a mage would need: mana regen, cdr, ap, and little bit of mobility.  http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Black_Market_Brawlers

All the books and Staff of Flowing Water were basically replacements for Morello's/Athene's, so that wouldn't really help. 

To expand on my point more, just look at all the options other classes have to get CDR from items: 

ADCs/AD champions can get: Trinity Force, Black Cleaver, Youmuu's Ghostblade, Death's Dance, Essence Reaver.

Tanks can get: Frozen Heart, Spirit Visage, Iceborn Gauntlet, Banner of Command, Locket of the Iron Solari, Ohmwrecker (ok, its a joke) and some tanks/tanky bruisers get Black Cleaver or Trinity Force.

Supports can get all of the tank items plus Zeke's Harbinger, Mikael's Crucible, some can get Ardent Censer, and all of the gold-income items.

Every class can get Lucidity Boots.

So ADCs/AD champs have 6 items (and Essence Reaver should count as 2 since it gives CDR based on other items), tanks have 6-8 items, supports have 9-10 items.

Mages have 6 items, but 2 of them are mutually exclusive and 1 is super super niche: Morellonomicon/Athene's Unholy Grail, Lichbane, Nashor's Tooth, Will of the Ancients, Lucidity Boots. Realistically, WotA is extremely Niche (coughVladcough) and both Nashor's and Lichbane or pretty niche themselves and not viable items on most mages. Your average mage has almost no options to viably opt into CDR during a game.

Any ADC that wants 40% CDR can get it from just items. Any tank that wants 40% CDR can get it from just items. Any support that wants 40% CDR can get it from just items. Any mage that wants 40% CDR probably has to take 10% CDR in runes. I thought Riot really like items and item build paths being flexible for ever game, but mages can never go "Wow, I really want/need to get CDR this game, I guess I'll buy <insert-CDR-item-here>" but instead have to decide before the game starts if they want/need CDR in order to realistically reach the cap and that's their only choice. There's no flexibility in CDR for mages.

I know Riot has said they don't want mages to be able to get CDR so easily because they utilize it better than other classes, but I feel like being unable to get it wrong. Are mages "too strong" with CDR? Fine, then let them make the choice: CDR or actual damage. Give them a CDR item that they buy only for the CDR and let the other stats (AP/mana/mpen/HP/something) just be there to round it out. Hell, make it not-cost efficient on stats alone, but let the mages have a choice or option to get CDR if they really think that is the best path.
